normalised: One significant aspect is the concept of "previous year" and "assessment year." The "previous year" is the financial year in which income is earned (e.g., April one, two thousand and twenty three, to March thirty one, two thousand and twenty four), while the "assessment year" is the year in which the income earned in the previous year is assessed and taxed (e.g., April one, two thousand and twenty four, to March thirty one, two thousand and twenty five). Filing your I-T-R (Income Tax Return) by the due date, typically thirty first July for individuals and thirtieth October for companies subject to audit under section forty four A-B, is vital to avoid penalties under section two hundred and thirty four F.

Different G-S-T rates apply to various goods and services, ranging from zero percent to twenty eight percent, with certain items like essential food items being exempt.
